Our deepest fear is not that we are inadequate. Our deepest fear is that we are powerful beyond measure. It is our light, not our darkness, that frightens us most. We ask ourselves, who am I to be brilliant, gorgeous, talented and fabulous? Actually who are you not to be?  
Your self-worth is determined by you. You donâ€™t have to depend on someone telling you who you are. 
Trust yourself. Create the kind of self that you will be happy to live with all your life. Make the most of yourself by fanning the tiny, inner sparks of possibility into flames of achievement.  
When I was a child my mother said to me, â€˜If you become a soldier, youâ€™ll be a general. If you become a monk, youâ€™ll be the pope.â€™ Instead I became a painter and wound up as Picasso. 
The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity. 
Trying is winning in the moment. 
Do the one thing you think you cannot do. Fail at it. Try again. Do better the second time. 
Concern yourself not with what you tried and failed in, but with what it is still possible for you to do. 
Nothing really worth having is easy to get. The hard-fought battles, the goals won with sacrifice, are the ones that matter. 
We carry within us, the wonders we seek around us. 
Always be on the lookout for the presence of wonder. 
There are no great limits to growth because there are no limits of human intelligence, imagination, and wonder. 
Wonder is the beginning of wisdom. 
When it comes to health and well-being, regular exercise is about as close to a magic potion as you can get. 
Movement is a medicine for creating change in a person's physical, emotional, and mental states. 
A bear, however hard he tries, grows tubby without exercise. 
True enjoyment comes from activity of the mind and exercise of the body; the two are ever united. 
Fitness helps me think better, feel better, and move better. 
"To practice any art, no matter how well or badly, is a way to make your soul grow. So do it.
 "
Make visible what, without you, might perhaps never have been seen. 
What is creative living? Any life that is driven more strongly by curiosity than by fear. 
The most creative act you will ever undertake is the act of creating yourself. 
The desire to create is one of the deepest yearnings of the human soul. 
We have become not a melting pot but a beautiful mosaic. Different people, different beliefs, different yearnings, different hopes, different dreams. 
All for one and one for all, united we stand divided we fall. 
Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much. 
Service to a just cause rewards the worker with more real happiness and satisfaction than any other venture of life. 
Service to others is the rent you pay for your room here on earth. 
Wherever you turn, you can find someone who needs you. Even if it is a little thing, do something for which there is no pay but the privilege of doing it. Remember, you donâ€™t live in the world all of your own. 
If you become a helper of hearts, springs of wisdom will flow from your heart. 
If our hopes of building a better and safer world are to become more than wishful thinking, we will need the engagement of volunteers more than ever. 
Speak a word of affirmation at the right moment in a child's life and it's like lighting up a whole roomful of possibilities. 
Biology is the least of what makes someone a mother. 
Having kidsâ€”the responsibility of rearing good, kind, ethical, responsible human beingsâ€”is the biggest job anyone can embark on. 
There is no such thing as a perfect parent so just be a real one. 
Each day of our lives we make deposits in the memory banks of our children. 
Do you know the difference between education and experience? Education is when you read the fine print; experience is what you get when you don't. 
Children must be taught how to think, not what to think. 
True education does not consist merely in the acquiring of a few facts of science, history, literature, or art, but in the development of character. 
One child, one teacher, one book, one pen can change the world. 
Education is the way to move mountains, to build bridges, to change the world. 
The Earth is a fine place and worth fighting for. 
Nature is painting for us, day after day, pictures of infinite beauty. 
Knowing that you love the earth changes you, activates you to defend and protect and celebrate. But when you feel that the earth loves you in return, that feeling transforms the relationship from a one-way street into a sacred bond. 
No duty is more urgent than that of returning thanks. 
I have never been a millionaire. But I have enjoyed a great meal, a crackling fire, a glorious sunset, a walk with a friend, a hug from a child, a cup of soup, a kiss behind the ear. There are plenty of lifeâ€™s tiny delights for all of us. 
Appreciation...acknowledges the presence of good wherever you shine the light of your thankful thoughts. 
The most fortunate are those who have a wonderful capacity to appreciate again and again, freshly and naively, the basic goods of life, with awe, pleasure, wonder. 
The legacy of heroes is the memory of a great name and the inheritance of a great example. 
Blessed are those who can give without remembering and take without forgetting. 
We are here to add what we can to life, not to get what we can from life. 
Ambition is the path to success. Persistence is the vehicle you arrive in. 
Knowing trees, I understand the meaning of patience. Knowing grass, I can appreciate persistence. 
Itâ€™s what you learn after you know it all that counts. 
Learning is not attained by chance, it must be sought for with ardor and attended to with diligence. 
You donâ€™t learn to walk by following rules. You learn by doing, and by falling over. 
There are no mistakes in life, only lessons. There is no such thing as a negative experience, only opportunities to grow, learn and advance along the road of self-mastery. 
The only real mistake is the one from which we learn nothing. 
It is your response to winning and losing that makes you a winner or a loser.  
Victory is in the quality of the competition, not just the final score. 
Somewhere behind the athlete you've become and the hours of practice and the coaches who have pushed you is a little girl who fell in love with the game and never looked back... play for her. 
Do you know what my favorite part of the game is? The opportunity to play. 
Ask not what your teammates can do for you. Ask what you can do for your teammates. 
Don't be satisfied with stories of how things have gone with others. Unfold your own myth. 
It is not the mountain we conquer but ourselves. 
Your success will be determined by your own confidence and fortitude. 
Make yourself proud. 
Every time you smile at someone, it is an action of love, a gift to that person, a beautiful thing. 
All the statistics in the world canâ€™t measure the warmth of a smile. 
A smile is happiness youâ€™ll find right under your nose. 
Smile, it is the key that fits the lock of everybodyâ€™s heart. 
Loyalty is a decision, a resolution of the soul. 
Nothing is more noble, nothing more venerable, than loyalty. 
Loyalty is the strongest glueâ€”which makes a relationship last a lifetime.  
There may be people that have more talent than you, but thereâ€™s no excuse for anyone to work harder than you do.  
When you live for a strong purpose, hard work isnâ€™t an option. Itâ€™s a necessity. 
Successful people are not gifted; they just work hard, then succeed on purpose. 
I know the price of success: dedication, hard work, and an unremitting devotion to the things you want to see happen.  
Taking care of yourself doesn't mean me first, it means me too. 
A kind word is like a spring day. 
My mission in life is to be kind, compassionate, caring, and loving in order to find and feel the deepest joy of life. 
I feel the capacity to care is the thing which gives life its deepest significance. 
Never believe that a few caring people canâ€™t change the world. For, indeed, thatâ€™s all who ever have. 
Donâ€™t be afraid to expand yourself, to step out of your comfort zone. Thatâ€™s where the joy and the adventure lie. 
At times you have to leave the city of your comfort and go into the wilderness of your intuition. What you'll discover will be wonderful. What you'll discover is yourself. 
For what itâ€™s worth: itâ€™s never too late or, in my case, too early to be whoever you want to be. 
The most important thing in communication is to hear what isn't being said. 
There's a lot of difference between listening and hearing. 
Listening is a magnetic and strange thing, a creative force. The friends who listen to us are the ones we move toward. When we are listened to, it creates us, makes us unfold and expand. 
If human beings are perceived as potentials rather than problems, as possessing strengths instead of weaknesses, as unlimited rather than dull and unresponsive, then they thrive and grow to their capabilities. 
Find the goodâ€”and praise it. 
I have yet to find a man or woman, however exalted their station, who did not do better work and put forth greater effort under a spirit of approval than under a spirit of criticism.  
Promise yourself to be just as enthusiastic about the success of others as you are about your own. 
Be aware of what others are doing, applaud their efforts, acknowledge their successes, and encourage them in their pursuits. When we all help one another, everybody wins. 
Be happy in the moment, thatâ€™s enough. Each moment is all we need, not more. 
The basic root of happiness lies in our minds; outer circumstances are nothing more than adverse or favorable. 
The mind is just like a muscleâ€”the more you exercise it, the stronger it gets and the more it can expand. 
In the end, just three things matter: How well we have lived. How well we have loved. How well we have learned to let go. 
The most precious gift we can offer others is our presence. When mindfulness embraces those we love, they will bloom like flowers. 
For a seed to achieve its greatest expression, it must come completely undone. The shell cracks, its insides come out and everything changes. To someone who doesn't understand growth, it would look like complete destruction. 
Use what youâ€™ve been through as fuel, believe in yourself and be unstoppable! 
Every trial endured and weathered in the right spirit makes a soul nobler and stronger than it was before. 
I think your whole life shows in your face and you should be proud of that. 
A person who has good thoughts cannot ever be ugly. You can have a wonky nose and a crooked mouth and a double chin and stick-out teeth, but if you have good thoughts they will shine out of your face like sunbeams and you will always look lovely. 
True beauty does not shine; it attracts. 
To be beautiful means to be yourself. You donâ€™t need to be accepted by others. You need to accept yourself. 
True beauty is born through our actions and aspirations and in the kindness we offer to others. 
Every experience is a stitch in the fabric of your character. 
Adversity does not build character, it reveals it. 
If I take care of my character, my reputation will take care of itself. 
Nature is not matter only. She is also spirit. 
To walk into nature is to witness a thousand miracles. 
I speak not for myself but for those without voiceâ€¦ those who have fought for their rightsâ€¦ their right to live in peace, their right to be treated with dignity, their right to equality of opportunity, their right to be educated. 
I would like to be known as a person who is concerned about freedom and equality and justice and prosperity for all people. 
Honesty, equality, kindness, compassion, treating people the way you want to be treated and helping those in need. To me, those are traditional values. 
Never, never be afraid to do what's right. 
I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear. 
It may take courage to embrace the possibilities of your own potential, but once you've flown past the summit of your fears, nothing will seem impossible. 
You can choose courage, or you can choose comfort, but you cannot choose both. 
At the height of laughter, the universe is flung into a kaleidoscope of new possibilities. 
Remember, laughter is 10 times more powerful than screams. 
There is nothing in the world so irresistibly contagious as laughter and good humor. 
The magic in new beginnings is truly the most powerful of them all. 
I close my eyes to old ends. And open my heart to new beginnings. 
What a wonderful thought it is that some of the best days of our lives haven't even happened yet. 
Love is not only something you feel, it is something you do. 
And the Grinch, with his Grinch-feet ice cold in the snow, stood puzzling and puzzling, how could it be so? It came without ribbons. It came without tags. It came without packages, boxes or bags. And he puzzled and puzzled 'till his puzzler was sore. Then the Grinch thought of something he hadn't before. What if Christmas, he thought, doesn't come from a store? What if Christmas, perhaps, means a little bit more? 
The love in your heart wasn't put there to stay. Love isn't love 'til you give it away. 
My family is my life, and everything else comes second as far as what's important to me. 
Family and friends are hidden treasures, seek them and enjoy their riches. 
The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others. 
Life is a gift, and it offers us the privilege, opportunity, and responsibility to give something back by becoming more. 
We make a living by what we get. We make a life by what we give. 
At the end of the day, it's not about what you have or even what you've accomplishedâ€¦ It's about who you've lifted up, who you've made better. It's about what you've given back. 
We cannot cure the world of sorrows, but we can choose to live in joy. 
Joy; the kind of happiness that doesnâ€™t depend on what happens. 
Just follow your joy. Always. I think that if you do that, life will take you on the course that itâ€™s meant to take you. 
Joy is not in things; it is in us. 
Feeling gratitude and not expressing it is like wrapping a present and not giving it. 
Be thankful for what you have; you'll end up having more. If you concentrate on what you don't have, you will never, ever have enough. 
Spirit is like the wind, in that we canâ€™t see it but can see its effects, which are profound. 
It is the soul's duty to be loyal to its own desires. It must abandon itself to its master passion. 
A smile is a light in the window of the soul indicating that the heart is at home. 
Each person has an ideal, a hope, a dream which represents the soul. We must give to it the warmth of love, the light of understanding and the essence of encouragement. 
Neither genius, fame, nor love show the greatness of the soul. Only kindness can do that. 
Kindness is a language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see. 
We cannot reach the goal by mere words alone. Without practice, nothing can be achieved. 
It's not necessarily the amount of time you spend at practice that counts; it's what you put into the practice. 
We can each define ambition and progress for ourselves. The goal is to work toward a world where expectations are not set by the stereotypes that hold us back, but by our personal passion, talents and interests. 
Donâ€™t be afraid to be ambitious about your goals. Hard work never stops. Neither should your dreams. 
Ambition is a dream with a V8 engine. 
Whatever you want to do, do it now! There are only so many tomorrows. 
Life is a great and wondrous mystery, and the only thing we know that we have for sure is what is right here right now. Donâ€™t miss it.  
Think left and think right and think low and think high. Oh, the thinks you can think up if only you try! 
I believe we each walk our paths so we can learn and share those lessons with others. 
There is no joy in possession without sharing. 
Three keys to more abundant living: caring about others, daring for others, sharing with others. 
Thousands of candles can be lit from a single candle, and the life of the candle will not be shortened. Happiness never decreases by being shared. 
The miracle is this: the more we share the more we have. 
Make up your mind that no matter what comes your way, no matter how difficult, no matter how unfair, you will do more than simply survive. You will thrive in spite of it. 
Tough times never last, but tough people do. 
You never know how strong you are until being strong is the only choice you have. 
An essential aspect of creativity is not being afraid to fail. 
The most powerful, efficient energy source in the world is your own mind.Â  Explore and discover that it can make creative fuel from anything. 
A will finds a way. 
Obstacles donâ€™t have to stop you. If you run into a wall, donâ€™t turn around and give up. Figure out how to climb it, go through it or work around it. 
A dream doesn't become reality through magic; it takes sweat, determination and hard work. 
The difference between the impossible and the possible lies in a person's determination. 
Never, never, never give up. 
Passion is one great force that unleashes creativity, because if you're passionate about something, then you're more willing to take risks. 
Purpose is the reason you journey. Passion is the fire that lights the way. 
Nothing is as important as passion. No matter what you want to do with your life, be passionate. 
Passion is energy. Feel the power that comes from focusing on what excites you. 
Our uniqueness, our individuality, and our life experience molds us into fascinating beings. I pray we may all challenge ourselves to delve into the deepest resources of our hearts to cultivate an atmosphere of understanding, acceptance, tolerance, and compassion. We are all in this life together. 
True belonging doesnâ€™t require you to change who you are; it requires you to be who you are. 
Our job on earth isn't to criticize, reject, or judge. Our purpose is to offer a helping hand, compassion, and mercy. We are to do unto others as we hope they would do unto us. 
I believe that the greatest kindness is acceptance. 
And the day came when the risk to remain tight in a bud was more painful than the risk it took to blossom. 
It is important to remember that we cannot become what we need to be, by remaining what we are. 
Live your life by a compass, not a clock. 
Courtesies of a small and trivial character are the ones which strike deepest in the grateful and appreciating heart.

gt:
Let us see what love can do. 
We can't heal the world today. But we can begin with a voice of compassion, a heart of love, and an act of kindness. 
Listen with curiosity. Speak with honesty. Act with integrity. 
The most basic and powerful way to connect to another person is to listen. Just listen. 
Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens. 
Deep listening is the kind of listening that can help relieve the suffering of another person. 
Every person in this life has something to teachâ€”and as soon as you accept that, you open yourself to truly listening. 
There are no problems we cannot solve together, and very few that we can solve by ourselves. 
I always wondered why somebody didnâ€™t do something about that; then I realized that I am somebody. 
Let us develop respect for all living things. Let us try to replace violence and intolerance with understanding, compassion and love. 
We say 'things will turn out', but no. It's what we do that actually creates the future. 
When one tugs at a single thing in nature, one finds it attached to the rest of the world. 
Do not judge me by my success, judge me by how many times I fell down and got back up again. 
I can be changed by what happens to me. But I refuse to be reduced by it. 
Donâ€™t let a bad day trick you into thinking you have a bad life. 
Like tiny seeds with potent power to push through tough ground and become mighty trees, we hold innate reserves of unimaginable strength. We are resilient. 
Hardships often prepare ordinary people for an extraordinary destiny. 
Not all those who wander are lost. 
Life can only be understood backwards but it must be lived forwards. 
You have to create your life. You have to carve it, like a sculpture. 
The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience. 
If you can't fly then run, if you can't run then walk, if you can't walk then crawl, but whatever you do you have to keep moving forward. 
Ask yourself: Have you been kind today? Make kindness your modus operandi and change your world.  
One kind word can warm three winter months. 
You can be rich in spirit, kindness, love and all those things that you can't put a dollar sign on. 
Do things for people not because of who they are or what they do in return, but because of who you are. 
Ah, kindness. What a simple way to tell another struggling soul that there is love to be found in the world. 
One of the greatest things you can do to help others is not just to share and give what you have, but to help them discover what they have within themselves to help themselves. 
Believe that there's light at the end of the tunnel. Believe that you might be that light for someone else. 
Great opportunities to help others seldom come, but small ones surround us every day. 
If you get, give. If you learn, teach. 
When I was a boy and I would see scary things in the news, my mother would say to me, â€˜Look for the helpers. You will always find people who are helping.â€™ 
If the world seems cold to you, kindle fires to warm it. 
The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams. 
If we had no winter, the spring would not be so pleasant; if we did not sometimes taste of adversity, prosperity would not be so welcome. 
Become a possibilitarian. No matter how dark things seem to be or actually are, raise your sights and see possibilitiesâ€”always see them, for theyâ€™re always there. 
Love is better than anger. Hope is better than fear. Optimism is better than despair. So let us be loving, hopeful and optimistic. And weâ€™ll change the world. 
Do all the good you can. By all the means you can. In all the ways you can. In all the places you can. At all the times you can. To all the people you can. As long as ever you can. 
No one has ever become poor by giving. 
Wherever there is a human in need, there is an opportunity for kindness and to make a difference. 
From what we get, we can make a living; what we give, however, makes a life. 
The heart that gives, gathers. 
Touch the earth, speak of love, walk on common ground. 
We all live with the objective of being happy; our lives are all different and yet the same. 
We can find common ground only by moving to higher ground. 
Our similarities bring us to a common ground; our differences allow us to be fascinated by each other. 
We can learn to see each other and see ourselves in each other and recognize that human beings are more alike than we are unalike. 
Infuse your life with action. Don't wait for it to happen. Make it happen. Make your own future. Make your own hope. 
It's not enough to have lived. We should be determined to live for something. May I suggest that it be creating joy for others, sharing what we have for the betterment of personkind, bringing hope to the lost and love to the lonely. 
Hope sees the invisible, feels the intangible, and achieves the impossible. 
Hope is the thing with feathers that perches in the soul and sings the tunes without the words and never stops at all. 
It is often in the darkest skies that we see the brightest stars. 
Accomplishments will prove to be a journey, not a destination. 
Make the most of yourself by fanning the tiny, inner sparks of possibility into flames of achievement.  
There is no magic to achievement. Itâ€™s really about hard work, choices, and persistence. 
It doesn't matter who you are or where you come from. The ability to triumph begins with you. 
To achieve the impossible, it is precisely the unthinkable that must be thought. 
The more grateful I am, the more beauty I see. 
As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them. 
At times our own light goes out and is rekindled by a spark from another person. Each of us has cause to think with deep gratitude of those who have lit the flame within us. 
In our daily lives, we must see that it is not happiness that makes us grateful, but the gratefulness that makes us happy. 
Gratitude unlocks the fullness of life. It turns what we have into enough, and more. 
Work and live to serve others, leave the world a little better than you found it. 
Generosity consists not the sum given, but the manner in which it is bestowed. 
Charity and love are the sameâ€”with charity you give love, so don't just give money but reach out your hand instead. 
In necessary things, unity; in disputed things, liberty; in all things, charity. 
Charity is the root of all good works. 
If you want others to be happy, practice compassion; if you want to be happy, practice compassion.  
I know you've heard it a thousand times before, but it's true... hard work pays off. If you want to be good, you have to practice, practice, practice. 
"Do it again. Play it again. Sing it again. Read it again. Write it again. Sketch it again. Rehearse it again. Run it again. Try it again.
Because again is practice, and practice is improvement. "
Take chances, make mistakes. That's how you grow. 
Practice is the best of all instructors. 
The world is incomprehensibly beautifulâ€”an endless prospect of magic and wonder. 
To be whole. To be complete. Wildness reminds us what it means to be human, what we are connected to rather than what we are separate from. 
Of all the paths you take in life, make sure a few of them are dirt. 
Nature brings solace in all troubles. 
An early morning walk is a blessing for the whole day. 
To forgive is to set a prisoner free and discover that the prisoner was you. 
Without forgiveness, there's no future. 
You have many choices. You can choose forgiveness over revenge, joy over despair. You can choose action over apathy. 
Mistakes are always forgivable, if one has the courage to admit them. 
True forgiveness is when you can say â€˜Thank you for that experienceâ€™. 
Don't ever forget that you're a citizen of this world, and there are things you can do to lift the human spirit, things that are easy, things that are free, things that you can do every day: civility, respect, kindness, character. 
You may encounter many defeats, but you must not be defeated. In fact, it may be necessary to encounter the defeats, so you can know who you are, what you can rise from, how you can still come out of it. 
People grow through experience if they meet life honestly and courageously. This is how character is built. 
Our character is what we do when we think no one is looking. 
Character consists of what you do on the third and fourth tries. 
Laugh my friend, for laughter ignites a fire within the pit of your belly and awakens your being. 
The most wasted of all days is one without laughter. 
In all of living have much joy and laughter. Life is to be enjoyed not just endured. 
May your walls know joy, may every room hold laughter, and every window open to great possibility. 
Laughter is the shortest distance between two people. 
Listen carefully. The answers to our deepest questions are often whispered. 
With the gift of listening comes the gift of healing. 
Listening is about being present, not just about being quiet. 
Too often we underestimate the power of a touch, a smile, a kind word... all of which have the potential to turn a life around. 
Listening is where love begins: listening to ourselves and then to our neighbors. 
Be humble in your confidence yet courageous in your character. 
Humility is not thinking less of yourself, it's thinking of yourself less. 
True humility is being able to accept criticisms as graciously as we accept compliments. 
Pride is concerned with who is right. Humility is concerned with what is right. 
Humility is the solid foundation of all virtues. 
Acceptance doesn't mean resignation; it means understanding that something is what it is and that there's got to be a way through it. 
I think tolerance and acceptance and love is something that feeds every community. 
Acceptance is simply love in practice. When you love, you accept, when you lack love, you judge. 
As I get older, the more I stay focused on the acceptance of myself and others, and choose compassion over judgment and curiosity over fear. 
It's worth remembering that it is often the small steps, not the giant leaps, that bring about the most lasting change. 
Believe in yourself and go for it. 
Keep your dreams alive. Understand to achieve anything requires faith and belief in yourself, vision, hard work, determination, and dedication. Remember all things are possible for those who believe. 
Either I will find a way, or I will make one. 
Believe in yourself and all that you are. Know that there is something inside you that is greater than any obstacle. 
Donâ€™t let others tell you what you canâ€™t do. Don't let the limitations of others limit your vision. If you can remove your self-doubt and believe in yourself, you can achieve what you never thought possible. 
Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened. 
A smile is a curve that sets everything straight.  
Just one smile, immensely increases the beauty, of the universe. 
If you see someone without a smile, give them one of yours. 
Every breath we take, every step we make, can be filled with peace, joy and serenity. 
When we create peace and harmony and balance in our minds, we will find it in our lives.  
Peace begins with a smile. 
Choose love and peace will follow. Choose peace and love will follow. 
Peace, like charity, begins at home. 
"May love and laughter light your days, and warm your heart and home. May good and faithful friends be yours wherever you may roam...
 "
I believe in the spirit of equality and the spirit of this country as one of love and compassion and kindness. 
We lose ourselves in the things we love. We find ourselves there, too. 
You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe deserve your love and affection. 
You have the capability to change your life all with a simple shift in perspective. 
The smallest change in perspective can transform a life. What tiny attitude adjustment might turn your world around? 
It's not what you look at that matters, it's what you see.  
Wisdom is your perspective on life, your sense of balance, your understanding of how the various parts and principles apply and relate to each other. 
The best ideas emerge when very different perspectives meet. 
The biggest adventure you can take is to live the life of your dreams. 
Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things you didn't do than by the ones you did. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover. 
Don't be pushed by your problems, be led by your dreams. 
Although time seems to fly by, it never travels faster than one day at a time. Each day is a new opportunity to live your life to the fullest. 
Every great dream begins with a dreamer. 
Confidence comes not from always being right, but from not fearing to be wrong. 
Each time we face our fear, we gain strength, courage and confidence in the doing. 
Happiness and confidence are the prettiest things you can wear. 
Education breeds confidence. 
Do your little bit of good where you are; its those little bits of good put together that overwhelm the world. 
A single act of kindness throws out roots in all directions, and the roots spring up and make new trees. 
We rise by lifting others. 
To achieve a kinder world, we must approach kindness with ambition and dedication. We must practice it in every moment of our lives. Kindness is that important. 
How do we change the world? One random act of kindness at a time. 
Thereâ€™s a way to do it better. Find it. 
Self-discipline coupled with passion and innovation will get you far in this world. 
You have all the reason in the world to achieve your grandest dreams. Imagination plus innovation equals realization. 
Vulnerability is the birthplace of innovation, creativity and change. 
Innovation is to imagine the future and fill in the gaps. 
I'm not afraid of storms, for I'm learning to sail my ship. 
An investment in knowledge always pays the best interest. 
A love of learning has a lot to do with learning that we are loved. 
Education is everythingâ€”education is your power, education is your way in life for whatever you want to do. 
Learning is a treasure that will follow its owner everywhere. 
Unity is strengthâ€¦when there is teamwork and collaboration, wonderful things can be achieved. 
The essence of the beautiful is unity in variety. 
United we stand, divided we fall. 
Unity does not mean sameness. It means oneness of purpose. 
So powerful is the light of unity that it can illuminate the whole earth. 
Discovery is seeing what everybody else has seen, and thinking what nobody else has thought. 
Mistakes are the portals of discovery.

The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you'll go. 
In the case of good books, the point is not to see how many of them you can get through, but rather how many can get through to you.  
Between stimulus and response there is a space. In that space is our power to choose our response. In our response lies our growth and our freedom. 
How you look at it is pretty much how youâ€™ll see it. 
â€œWhat day is it?â€ asked Pooh. â€œItâ€™s today,â€ squeaked Piglet. â€œMy favorite day,â€ said Pooh. 
Whatever the present moment contains, accept it as if you had chosen it. Always work with it, not against it. 
Mindfulness is simply being aware of what is happening right now without wishing it were different; enjoying the pleasant without holding on when it changes (which it will); being with the unpleasant without fearing it will always be this way (which it wonâ€™t). 
They say a person needs just three things to be truly happy in this world: someone to love, something to do, and something to hope for. 
Chance is always powerful. Let your hook be always cast; in the pool where you least expect it, there will be a fish. 
The best way to not feel hopeless is to get up and do something. Donâ€™t wait for good things to happen to you. If you go out and make some good things happen, you will fill the world with hope, you will fill yourself with hope. 
We must accept finite disappointment, but we must never lose infinite hope. 
Hope can be a powerful force. Maybe there's no actual magic in it, but when you know what you hope for most and hold it like a light within you, you can make things happen, almost like magic. 
Most people are like you and me, or the people across the street or around the world from you and me. Just like you and me, their hearts tell them that somewhere, somehow, they can make a positive difference in the world.  
Aim to make a difference in someoneâ€™s life every single day, including your own. 
It takes each of us to make a difference for all of us. 
Never underestimate the valuable and important difference you make in every life you touch for the impact you make today has a powerful rippling effect on every tomorrow. 
What you do makes a difference and you have to decide what kind of a difference you want to make. 
We all came in on different ships, but we're all in the same boat now. 
The diversity in the human family should be the cause of love and harmony, as it is in music where many different notes blend together in the making of a perfect chord. 
Nurturing an inclusive culture begins in the family. Home is the first place to foster openness and a culture of inclusion. 
We could learn a lot from crayons; some are sharp, some are pretty, some are dull, while others bright, some have weird names, but they all have learned to live together in the same box. 
Our deepest fear is not that we are inadequate. Our deepest fear is that we are powerful beyond measure. It is our light, not our darkness, that frightens us most. We ask ourselves, who am I to be brilliant, gorgeous, talented and fabulous? Actually who are you not to be?  
Your self-worth is determined by you. You donâ€™t have to depend on someone telling you who you are. 
Trust yourself. Create the kind of self that you will be happy to live with all your life. Make the most of yourself by fanning the tiny, inner sparks of possibility into flames of achievement.  
When I was a child my mother said to me, â€˜If you become a soldier, youâ€™ll be a general. If you become a monk, youâ€™ll be the pope.â€™ Instead I became a painter and wound up as Picasso. 
The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity. 
Trying is winning in the moment. 
Do the one thing you think you cannot do. Fail at it. Try again. Do better the second time. 
Concern yourself not with what you tried and failed in, but with what it is still possible for you to do. 
Nothing really worth having is easy to get. The hard-fought battles, the goals won with sacrifice, are the ones that matter. 
We carry within us, the wonders we seek around us. 
Always be on the lookout for the presence of wonder. 
There are no great limits to growth because there are no limits of human intelligence, imagination, and wonder. 
Wonder is the beginning of wisdom. 
When it comes to health and well-being, regular exercise is about as close to a magic potion as you can get. 
Movement is a medicine for creating change in a person's physical, emotional, and mental states. 
A bear, however hard he tries, grows tubby without exercise. 
True enjoyment comes from activity of the mind and exercise of the body; the two are ever united. 
Fitness helps me think better, feel better, and move better. 
"To practice any art, no matter how well or badly, is a way to make your soul grow. So do it.
 "
Make visible what, without you, might perhaps never have been seen. 
What is creative living? Any life that is driven more strongly by curiosity than by fear. 
The most creative act you will ever undertake is the act of creating yourself. 
The desire to create is one of the deepest yearnings of the human soul. 
We have become not a melting pot but a beautiful mosaic. Different people, different beliefs, different yearnings, different hopes, different dreams. 
All for one and one for all, united we stand divided we fall. 
Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much. 
Service to a just cause rewards the worker with more real happiness and satisfaction than any other venture of life. 
Service to others is the rent you pay for your room here on earth. 
Wherever you turn, you can find someone who needs you. Even if it is a little thing, do something for which there is no pay but the privilege of doing it. Remember, you donâ€™t live in the world all of your own. 
If you become a helper of hearts, springs of wisdom will flow from your heart. 
If our hopes of building a better and safer world are to become more than wishful thinking, we will need the engagement of volunteers more than ever. 
Speak a word of affirmation at the right moment in a child's life and it's like lighting up a whole roomful of possibilities. 
Biology is the least of what makes someone a mother. 
Having kidsâ€”the responsibility of rearing good, kind, ethical, responsible human beingsâ€”is the biggest job anyone can embark on. 
There is no such thing as a perfect parent so just be a real one. 
Each day of our lives we make deposits in the memory banks of our children. 
Do you know the difference between education and experience? Education is when you read the fine print; experience is what you get when you don't. 
Children must be taught how to think, not what to think. 
True education does not consist merely in the acquiring of a few facts of science, history, literature, or art, but in the development of character. 
One child, one teacher, one book, one pen can change the world. 
Education is the way to move mountains, to build bridges, to change the world. 
The Earth is a fine place and worth fighting for. 
Nature is painting for us, day after day, pictures of infinite beauty. 
Knowing that you love the earth changes you, activates you to defend and protect and celebrate. But when you feel that the earth loves you in return, that feeling transforms the relationship from a one-way street into a sacred bond. 
No duty is more urgent than that of returning thanks. 
I have never been a millionaire. But I have enjoyed a great meal, a crackling fire, a glorious sunset, a walk with a friend, a hug from a child, a cup of soup, a kiss behind the ear. There are plenty of lifeâ€™s tiny delights for all of us. 
Appreciation...acknowledges the presence of good wherever you shine the light of your thankful thoughts. 
The most fortunate are those who have a wonderful capacity to appreciate again and again, freshly and naively, the basic goods of life, with awe, pleasure, wonder. 
The legacy of heroes is the memory of a great name and the inheritance of a great example. 
Blessed are those who can give without remembering and take without forgetting. 
We are here to add what we can to life, not to get what we can from life. 
Ambition is the path to success. Persistence is the vehicle you arrive in. 
Knowing trees, I understand the meaning of patience. Knowing grass, I can appreciate persistence. 
Itâ€™s what you learn after you know it all that counts. 
Learning is not attained by chance, it must be sought for with ardor and attended to with diligence. 
You donâ€™t learn to walk by following rules. You learn by doing, and by falling over. 
There are no mistakes in life, only lessons. There is no such thing as a negative experience, only opportunities to grow, learn and advance along the road of self-mastery. 
The only real mistake is the one from which we learn nothing. 
It is your response to winning and losing that makes you a winner or a loser.  
Victory is in the quality of the competition, not just the final score. 
Somewhere behind the athlete you've become and the hours of practice and the coaches who have pushed you is a little girl who fell in love with the game and never looked back... play for her. 
Do you know what my favorite part of the game is? The opportunity to play. 
Ask not what your teammates can do for you. Ask what you can do for your teammates. 
Don't be satisfied with stories of how things have gone with others. Unfold your own myth. 
It is not the mountain we conquer but ourselves. 
Your success will be determined by your own confidence and fortitude. 
Make yourself proud. 
Every time you smile at someone, it is an action of love, a gift to that person, a beautiful thing. 
All the statistics in the world canâ€™t measure the warmth of a smile. 
A smile is happiness youâ€™ll find right under your nose. 
Smile, it is the key that fits the lock of everybodyâ€™s heart. 
Loyalty is a decision, a resolution of the soul. 
Nothing is more noble, nothing more venerable, than loyalty. 
Loyalty is the strongest glueâ€”which makes a relationship last a lifetime.  
There may be people that have more talent than you, but thereâ€™s no excuse for anyone to work harder than you do.  
When you live for a strong purpose, hard work isnâ€™t an option. Itâ€™s a necessity. 
Successful people are not gifted; they just work hard, then succeed on purpose. 
I know the price of success: dedication, hard work, and an unremitting devotion to the things you want to see happen.  
Taking care of yourself doesn't mean me first, it means me too. 
A kind word is like a spring day. 
My mission in life is to be kind, compassionate, caring, and loving in order to find and feel the deepest joy of life. 
I feel the capacity to care is the thing which gives life its deepest significance. 
Never believe that a few caring people canâ€™t change the world. For, indeed, thatâ€™s all who ever have. 
Donâ€™t be afraid to expand yourself, to step out of your comfort zone. Thatâ€™s where the joy and the adventure lie. 
At times you have to leave the city of your comfort and go into the wilderness of your intuition. What you'll discover will be wonderful. What you'll discover is yourself. 
For what itâ€™s worth: itâ€™s never too late or, in my case, too early to be whoever you want to be. 
The most important thing in communication is to hear what isn't being said. 
There's a lot of difference between listening and hearing. 
Listening is a magnetic and strange thing, a creative force. The friends who listen to us are the ones we move toward. When we are listened to, it creates us, makes us unfold and expand. 
If human beings are perceived as potentials rather than problems, as possessing strengths instead of weaknesses, as unlimited rather than dull and unresponsive, then they thrive and grow to their capabilities. 
Find the goodâ€”and praise it. 
I have yet to find a man or woman, however exalted their station, who did not do better work and put forth greater effort under a spirit of approval than under a spirit of criticism.  
Promise yourself to be just as enthusiastic about the success of others as you are about your own. 
Be aware of what others are doing, applaud their efforts, acknowledge their successes, and encourage them in their pursuits. When we all help one another, everybody wins. 
Be happy in the moment, thatâ€™s enough. Each moment is all we need, not more. 
The basic root of happiness lies in our minds; outer circumstances are nothing more than adverse or favorable. 
The mind is just like a muscleâ€”the more you exercise it, the stronger it gets and the more it can expand. 
In the end, just three things matter: How well we have lived. How well we have loved. How well we have learned to let go. 
The most precious gift we can offer others is our presence. When mindfulness embraces those we love, they will bloom like flowers. 
For a seed to achieve its greatest expression, it must come completely undone. The shell cracks, its insides come out and everything changes. To someone who doesn't understand growth, it would look like complete destruction. 
Use what youâ€™ve been through as fuel, believe in yourself and be unstoppable! 
Every trial endured and weathered in the right spirit makes a soul nobler and stronger than it was before. 
I think your whole life shows in your face and you should be proud of that. 
A person who has good thoughts cannot ever be ugly. You can have a wonky nose and a crooked mouth and a double chin and stick-out teeth, but if you have good thoughts they will shine out of your face like sunbeams and you will always look lovely. 
True beauty does not shine; it attracts. 
To be beautiful means to be yourself. You donâ€™t need to be accepted by others. You need to accept yourself. 
True beauty is born through our actions and aspirations and in the kindness we offer to others. 
Every experience is a stitch in the fabric of your character. 
Adversity does not build character, it reveals it. 
If I take care of my character, my reputation will take care of itself. 
Nature is not matter only. She is also spirit. 
To walk into nature is to witness a thousand miracles. 
I speak not for myself but for those without voiceâ€¦ those who have fought for their rightsâ€¦ their right to live in peace, their right to be treated with dignity, their right to equality of opportunity, their right to be educated. 
I would like to be known as a person who is concerned about freedom and equality and justice and prosperity for all people. 
Honesty, equality, kindness, compassion, treating people the way you want to be treated and helping those in need. To me, those are traditional values. 
Never, never be afraid to do what's right. 
I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear. 
It may take courage to embrace the possibilities of your own potential, but once you've flown past the summit of your fears, nothing will seem impossible. 
You can choose courage, or you can choose comfort, but you cannot choose both. 
At the height of laughter, the universe is flung into a kaleidoscope of new possibilities. 
Remember, laughter is 10 times more powerful than screams. 
There is nothing in the world so irresistibly contagious as laughter and good humor. 
The magic in new beginnings is truly the most powerful of them all. 
I close my eyes to old ends. And open my heart to new beginnings. 
What a wonderful thought it is that some of the best days of our lives haven't even happened yet. 
Love is not only something you feel, it is something you do. 
And the Grinch, with his Grinch-feet ice cold in the snow, stood puzzling and puzzling, how could it be so? It came without ribbons. It came without tags. It came without packages, boxes or bags. And he puzzled and puzzled 'till his puzzler was sore. Then the Grinch thought of something he hadn't before. What if Christmas, he thought, doesn't come from a store? What if Christmas, perhaps, means a little bit more? 
The love in your heart wasn't put there to stay. Love isn't love 'til you give it away. 
My family is my life, and everything else comes second as far as what's important to me. 
Family and friends are hidden treasures, seek them and enjoy their riches. 
The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others. 
Life is a gift, and it offers us the privilege, opportunity, and responsibility to give something back by becoming more. 
We make a living by what we get. We make a life by what we give. 
At the end of the day, it's not about what you have or even what you've accomplishedâ€¦ It's about who you've lifted up, who you've made better. It's about what you've given back. 
We cannot cure the world of sorrows, but we can choose to live in joy. 
Joy; the kind of happiness that doesnâ€™t depend on what happens. 
Just follow your joy. Always. I think that if you do that, life will take you on the course that itâ€™s meant to take you. 
Joy is not in things; it is in us. 
Feeling gratitude and not expressing it is like wrapping a present and not giving it. 
Be thankful for what you have; you'll end up having more. If you concentrate on what you don't have, you will never, ever have enough. 
Spirit is like the wind, in that we canâ€™t see it but can see its effects, which are profound. 
It is the soul's duty to be loyal to its own desires. It must abandon itself to its master passion. 
A smile is a light in the window of the soul indicating that the heart is at home. 
Each person has an ideal, a hope, a dream which represents the soul. We must give to it the warmth of love, the light of understanding and the essence of encouragement. 
Neither genius, fame, nor love show the greatness of the soul. Only kindness can do that. 
Kindness is a language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see. 
We cannot reach the goal by mere words alone. Without practice, nothing can be achieved. 
It's not necessarily the amount of time you spend at practice that counts; it's what you put into the practice. 
We can each define ambition and progress for ourselves. The goal is to work toward a world where expectations are not set by the stereotypes that hold us back, but by our personal passion, talents and interests. 
Donâ€™t be afraid to be ambitious about your goals. Hard work never stops. Neither should your dreams. 
Ambition is a dream with a V8 engine. 
Whatever you want to do, do it now! There are only so many tomorrows. 
Life is a great and wondrous mystery, and the only thing we know that we have for sure is what is right here right now. Donâ€™t miss it.  
Think left and think right and think low and think high. Oh, the thinks you can think up if only you try! 
I believe we each walk our paths so we can learn and share those lessons with others. 
There is no joy in possession without sharing. 
Three keys to more abundant living: caring about others, daring for others, sharing with others. 
Thousands of candles can be lit from a single candle, and the life of the candle will not be shortened. Happiness never decreases by being shared. 
The miracle is this: the more we share the more we have. 
Make up your mind that no matter what comes your way, no matter how difficult, no matter how unfair, you will do more than simply survive. You will thrive in spite of it. 
Tough times never last, but tough people do. 
You never know how strong you are until being strong is the only choice you have. 
An essential aspect of creativity is not being afraid to fail. 
The most powerful, efficient energy source in the world is your own mind.Â  Explore and discover that it can make creative fuel from anything. 
A will finds a way. 
Obstacles donâ€™t have to stop you. If you run into a wall, donâ€™t turn around and give up. Figure out how to climb it, go through it or work around it. 
A dream doesn't become reality through magic; it takes sweat, determination and hard work. 
The difference between the impossible and the possible lies in a person's determination. 
Never, never, never give up. 
Passion is one great force that unleashes creativity, because if you're passionate about something, then you're more willing to take risks. 
Purpose is the reason you journey. Passion is the fire that lights the way. 
Nothing is as important as passion. No matter what you want to do with your life, be passionate. 
Passion is energy. Feel the power that comes from focusing on what excites you. 
Our uniqueness, our individuality, and our life experience molds us into fascinating beings. I pray we may all challenge ourselves to delve into the deepest resources of our hearts to cultivate an atmosphere of understanding, acceptance, tolerance, and compassion. We are all in this life together. 
True belonging doesnâ€™t require you to change who you are; it requires you to be who you are. 
Our job on earth isn't to criticize, reject, or judge. Our purpose is to offer a helping hand, compassion, and mercy. We are to do unto others as we hope they would do unto us. 
I believe that the greatest kindness is acceptance. 
And the day came when the risk to remain tight in a bud was more painful than the risk it took to blossom. 
It is important to remember that we cannot become what we need to be, by remaining what we are. 
Live your life by a compass, not a clock. 
Courtesies of a small and trivial character are the ones which strike deepest in the grateful and appreciating heart.

full_answer:
kindness. What a simple way to tell another struggling soul that there is love to be found in the world. 
One of the greatest things you can do to help others is not just to share and give what you have, but to help them discover what they have within themselves to help themselves. 
Believe that there's light at the end of the tunnel. Believe that you might be that light for someone else. 
Great opportunities to help others seldom come, but small ones surround us every day. 
If you get, give. If you learn, teach. 
When I was a boy and I would see scary things in the news, my mother would say to me, â€˜Look for the helpers. You will always find people who are helping.â€™ 
If the world seems cold to you, kindle fires to warm it. 
The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams. 
If we had no winter, the spring would not be so pleasant; if we did not sometimes taste of adversity, prosperity would not be so welcome. 
Become a possibilitarian. No matter how dark things seem to be or actually are, raise your sights and see possibilitiesâ€”always see them, for theyâ€™re always there. 
Love is better than anger. Hope is better than fear. Optimism is better than despair. So let us be loving, hopeful and optimistic. And weâ€™ll change the world. 
Do all the good you can. By all the means you can. In all the ways you can. In all the places you can. At all the times you can. To all the people you can. As long as ever you can. 
No one has ever become poor by giving. 
Wherever there is a human in need, there is an opportunity for kindness and to make a difference. 
From what we get, we can make a living; what we give, however, makes a life. 
The heart that gives, gathers. 
Touch the earth, speak of love, walk on common ground. 
We all live with the objective of being happy; our lives are all different and yet the same. 
We can find common ground only by moving to higher ground. 
Our similarities bring us to a common ground; our differences allow us to be fascinated by each other. 
We can learn to see each other and see ourselves in each other and recognize that human beings are more alike than we are unalike. 
Infuse your life with action. Don't wait for it to happen. Make it happen. Make your own future. Make your own hope. 
It's not enough to have lived. We should be determined to live for something. May I suggest that it be creating joy for others, sharing what we have for the betterment of personkind, bringing hope to the lost and love to the lonely. 
Hope sees the invisible, feels the intangible, and achieves the impossible. 
Hope is the thing with feathers that perches in the soul and sings the tunes without the words and never stops at all. 
It is often in the darkest skies that we see the brightest stars. 
Accomplishments will prove to be a journey, not a destination. 
Make the most of yourself by fanning the tiny, inner sparks of possibility into flames of achievement.  
There is no magic to achievement. Itâ€™s really about hard work, choices, and persistence. 
It doesn't matter who you are or where you come from. The ability to triumph begins with you. 
To achieve the impossible, it is precisely the unthinkable that must be thought. 
The more grateful I am, the more beauty I see. 
As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them. 
At times our own light goes out and is rekindled by a spark from another person. Each of us has cause to think with deep gratitude of those who have lit the flame within us. 
In our daily lives, we must see that it is not happiness that makes us grateful, but the gratefulness that makes us happy. 
Gratitude unlocks the fullness of life. It turns what we have into enough, and more. 
Work and live to serve others, leave the world a little better than you found it. 
Generosity consists not the sum given, but the manner in which it is bestowed. 
Charity and love are the sameâ€”with charity you give love, so don't just give money but reach out your hand instead. 
In necessary things, unity; in disputed things, liberty; in all things, charity. 
Charity is the root of all good works. 
If you want others to be happy, practice compassion; if you want to be happy, practice compassion.  
I know you've heard it a thousand times before, but it's true... hard work pays off. If you want to be good, you have to practice, practice, practice. 
"Do it again. Play it again. Sing it again. Read it again. Write it again. Sketch it again. Rehearse it again. Run it again. Try it again.
Because again is practice, and practice is improvement. "
Take chances, make mistakes. That's how you grow.
